summary: LoginCard.tsx was redesigned toward a screenshot-style login UI with a dark background, white rounded sheet, title, sign-up row, disabled email/password inputs, an Internet Identity helper banner, password visibility toggle, and link-styled buttons. However, the diff is truncated around the Continue button and does not fully evidence required loading/disabled CTA behavior, exact wording, or the non-breaking link/modal behavior. Unrequested changes appear in project_state.json and frontend-file-summaries.txt.

missing_requirements.requirement: All user-facing text on this screen is in English and matches the screenshot wording (including capitalization and punctuation).
missing_requirements.reason: The sign-up row uses "Don't have an account?" (straight apostrophe) instead of the specified "Donâ€™t have an account?" (curly apostrophe). Also, the input placeholders differ from the specified screenshot-style "email + password" fields (diff shows "Enter your email address" and "Enter password"), which may not match the required wording.

missing_requirements.requirement: Wide rounded "Continue" primary CTA at the bottom of the sheet.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff is truncated at the Continue button's onClick handler, so width, placement at the bottom, and rounded styling cannot be verified from the provided summary.

missing_requirements.requirement: Clicking "Continue" starts the Internet Identity login flow and shows a loading state (spinner + disabled CTA) while loginStatus is "logging-in".
missing_requirements.reason: Although loginStatus/isLoggingIn and handleContinue() calling login() exist, the diff is truncated before the Button props/rendering, so the spinner/disabled CTA behavior while logging in cannot be confirmed.

missing_requirements.requirement: "Forgot Password?" and "Sign up" are rendered as links/buttons with hover/focus styles and do not break navigation (they may open an informational modal/toast if no dedicated routes exist).
missing_requirements.reason: The buttons have hover styling and click handlers that set showInfoDialog=true, but the actual informational dialog/toast rendering is not shown in the truncated diff, so the non-breaking behavior cannot be verified.
